main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
Restoration House, guided by Donovan Harris, Reentry-Housing Director, embodies a transformative journey for women returning from incarceration. It centers around the 3 R’s: Reentry, Redirection, and Restoration. This approach recognizes the need for changing thought patterns, lifestyles, and habits as part of a comprehensive process toward positive change. Restoration, as the ultimate goal, focuses on reintegrating individuals into society with a renewed focus on family, home, business, and Christian faith. 
Restoration House serves as a crucial emergency and transitional shelter, also functioning as a drop-in center, where numerous women have already found support, peer connections, and nurturing guidance. This space is more than just a shelter; it’s a pivotal step towards a restored life, offering a haven for peer support and soulful conversations, laying the foundation for a hopeful future. 
 
South Street Ministries also offers other services in the Ex-Offender category and services in the Mental Health, Addiction, & Family Services and Transportation categories.

hotspots.name: The Front Porch – South Street Ministries

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Front Porch is a community gathering place that supports individuals in transition by providing recreational activities, drug and alcohol recovery meetings, employment assistance, and more. Operated by South Street Ministries, this facility is home to support groups where previously incarcerated individuals can receive encouragement and reentry tips to assist their return to the community, enhancing their ability to remain crime-free.  
 
The Front Porch also hosts peer-to-peer Re-Entry Support Services every Tuesday. Each session varies, featuring speakers, Q&A sessions, guest presenters, and always concluding with a communal meal, Christian prayer, and an affirmation of love. 
 
The Front Porch is also home to Porch Light Coffee Co., offering a place of hospitality, equity, and diversity alongside crafted coffee beverages and café food options. Please visit https://southstreetministries.org/the-front-porch/ for complete support group schedules.  
 
South Street Ministries also offers other services in the Ex-Offender category and services in the Mental Health, Addiction, & Family Services and Transportation categories.

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
The Special Housing Adjustment Residential Program (SHARP) program provides a structured living environment for community corrections clients who have mental illness and may also need substance use treatment. The program partners with providers of mental health services to integrate the client into the community and arrange for stable housing.  
 
Operated by Oriana House, residential services are offered at separate locations to men and women in Summit County who have been referred by the court system. Oriana House is dedicated to helping people triumph over addiction and mental illness and provides community corrections programming that helps individuals develop productive, responsible, and law-abiding lives.

main_pages.title: SERVICES
main_pages.description:
Ohio Means Jobs Summit County provides comprehensive employment and training services as home to several workforce providers under one roof for businesses and job seekers, including assistive services for job seekers with a criminal record. They also provide vocational assessments, youth and veteran employment programs, and special programs detailed in the Workforce Innovation and Opportunities Act, including skills assessments, on-the-job-training opportunities, and career workshops. 
 
For more information on job searching with a criminal record, job searching with a criminal history, legal barriers facing restored citizens, and plans for re-entry, visit https://ohiomeansjobs.ohio.gov/job-seekers/build-your-career/for-restored-citizens. 
 
Ohio Means Jobs Summit County also provides services in the Work, Financial, & Legal Support category.
